title: Restrict overly permissive filesystem scope in Tauri capabilities
description: The fs:scope in src-tauri/capabilities/default.json includes '**' and '**/.*' wildcards which grant access to the ENTIRE filesystem including system directories. Combined with fs:allow-read-text-file, fs:allow-write-text-file, fs:allow-remove, and fs:allow-rename, this means any XSS in dependencies (e.g. Monaco) could read ~/.ssh/id_rsa, ~/.aws/credentials, or modify system files. Remove the '**' and '**/.*' entries and rely on the file picker dialog for paths outside user directories.

Add path traversal validation in renameTab()
description: In App.svelte renameTab(), the newName parameter is used directly in path construction (dir + '/' + trimmed) without validating for path traversal characters. A name like '../../../etc/passwd' would construct a path outside the intended directory. While Tauri's permission system provides some protection, defense-in-depth requires client-side validation. Reject filenames containing '..' or starting with '/'.
